body_html:
Got it. For posterity, can you tell us the original reshape operations and the new expand_dim versions? If you can expand_dim and preserve shape, then presumably the reshape should work too. This may be a shape inference bug on our end.
…
On Thu, Feb 16, 2017 at 10:54 PM, Shubham Toshniwal < ***@***.***> wrote: As it turns out, it was just a matter of avoiding certain reshape operations. So I just replaced those by expand_dim operations and things are working fine now. Using dynamic_rnn in encoder and raw_rnn in decoder, I was able to avoid the bucketing shenanigan. Again, thanks for the help and I will close this issue. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#7595 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim1oKwlgUsrN05Kveini0ssByb4kGks5rdUQpgaJpZM4MDp5g> .
body_text:
Got it.  For posterity, can you tell us the original reshape operations and
the new expand_dim versions?  If you can expand_dim and preserve shape,
then presumably the reshape should work too.  This may be a shape inference
bug on our end.
…
On Thu, Feb 16, 2017 at 10:54 PM, Shubham Toshniwal < ***@***.***> wrote:
 As it turns out, it was just a matter of avoiding certain reshape
 operations. So I just replaced those by expand_dim operations and things
 are working fine now.

 Using dynamic_rnn in encoder and raw_rnn in decoder, I was able to avoid
 the bucketing shenanigan. Again, thanks for the help and I will close this
 issue.

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body:
Got it.  For posterity, can you tell us the original reshape operations and
the new expand_dim versions?  If you can expand_dim and preserve shape,
then presumably the reshape should work too.  This may be a shape inference
bug on our end.

On Thu, Feb 16, 2017 at 10:54 PM, Shubham Toshniwal <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> As it turns out, it was just a matter of avoiding certain reshape
> operations. So I just replaced those by expand_dim operations and things
> are working fine now.
>
> Using dynamic_rnn in encoder and raw_rnn in decoder, I was able to avoid
> the bucketing shenanigan. Again, thanks for the help and I will close this
> issue.
>
> —

> .
